## Course Information
**Instructor:** Prof. Nipun Batra, IIT Gandhinagar
**Target Audience:** 1st Year Students
**Format:** Lectures + Hands-on Labs
**Repository:** [github.com/nipunbatra/principles-ai-teaching](https://github.com/nipunbatra/principles-ai-teaching)
:::

## About This Course

This course provides a **practical introduction to AI and Machine Learning** for beginners. Starting from classical ML concepts, we progress through neural networks to modern applications like language models and object detection.

::: {.callout-tip}
## Learning Approach
Each topic combines intuitive explanations with hands-on coding. Labs use real datasets and popular frameworks (scikit-learn, PyTorch, Ultralytics) that you'll encounter in industry and research.
:::

### What You'll Learn

| Module | Key Skills |
|--------|------------|
| **Classical ML** | Classification, regression, clustering, decision trees |
| **Deep Learning** | Neural networks, PyTorch, training loops |
| **Language Models** | Next-token prediction, embeddings, text generation |
| **Computer Vision** | Object detection, YOLO, bounding boxes, IoU |

## Part I: Machine Learning Foundations

::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"}
**Learning Goal:** Understand the landscape of ML tasks and build intuition with classical algorithms.
:::

### ML Tasks Taxonomy

Understanding different types of machine learning problems and when to use each.

**Key Concepts:** Supervised vs Unsupervised, Classification vs Regression, Structured vs Unstructured Data

| | Materials |
|--|:--|
| **Lecture** | [HTML](ml-tasks/ml-tasks-taxonomy.html) ∙ [PDF](ml-tasks/ml-tasks-taxonomy.pdf) ∙ [Source](https://github.com/nipunbatra/principles-ai-teaching/blob/main/ml-tasks/ml-tasks-taxonomy.md) |

**Topics Covered:**

- The AI/ML landscape
- Supervised learning (classification, regression)
- Unsupervised learning (clustering, dimensionality reduction)
- When to use what approach

---

### ML Tasks Zoo

A comprehensive tour of 30+ ML tasks across vision, NLP, audio, and genertic AI.

**Key Concepts:** Task hierarchies, real-world applications, model selection

| | Materials |
|--|:--|
| **Lecture** | [HTML](ml-tasks/ml-tasks-zoo.html) ∙ [PDF](ml-tasks/ml-tasks-zoo.pdf) ∙ [Source](https://github.com/nipunbatra/principles-ai-teaching/blob/main/ml-tasks/ml-tasks-zoo.md) |

**Topics Covered:**

- Computer Vision tasks (classification, detection, segmentation, pose)
- NLP tasks (sentiment, NER, translation, QA, summarization)
- Audio tasks (speech recognition, synthesis, music generation)
- Generative AI (image generation, LLMs, video synthesis)

**Key Concepts:** Probability distributions, bigrams, embeddings, attention, transformers

**Topics Covered:**

- Why "next token prediction" is so powerful
- Bigram models and probability tables
- Neural language models and embeddings
- Attention mechanism and transformers
- From GPT to ChatGPT (SFT + RLHF)

## Part IV: Computer Vision & Object Detection

::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"}
**Learning Goal:** Detect and locate objects in images using state-of-the-art YOLO models.
:::

### Object Detection Basics

From classification to detection: finding WHAT and WHERE.

**Key Concepts:** Bounding boxes, IoU, NMS, YOLO, mAP

| | Materials |
|--|:--|
| **Lecture** | [HTML](object-detection/object-detection-basics.html) ∙ [PDF](object-detection/object-detection-basics.pdf) ∙ [Source](https://github.com/nipunbatra/principles-ai-teaching/blob/main/object-detection/object-detection-basics.md) |

**Topics Covered:**

- Classification vs Detection vs Segmentation
- Bounding box formats and coordinates
- IoU (Intersection over Union)
- Non-Maximum Suppression (NMS)
- YOLO architecture and evolution
- Training and evaluation (mAP)
